properties.areaDesc: Clear Lake/Southern Lake County; Southern Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Northern Lake County; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 10:33AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
* Snow: A dusting of snow to an inch in the Sierra Foothills and
up to 5 inches over higher elevations of the Sierra Nevada and
western Plumas County.

* Rain: A few hundredths of an inch of rain in the Valley and
Foothills and up a third of an inch over the higher Sierra
elevations.

* Timing: Light precipitation Saturday night into early Sunday
over the Coastal Range and Shasta County mountains, then mainly
over the West Slope Sierra Nevada and Foothills Sunday and
Sunday night.

* Temperatures: High temperatures in the 50s and 60s Saturday,
turning colder Sunday and Monday with highs in the 30s and 40s
in the mountains, and low 50s in the Valley. Low temperatures in
the 30s and 40s Sunday, lowering into the teens and 20s in the
foothills and mountains, and 30s in the Valley on Monday.

* Winds: Wind gusts 30 to 45 mph in the Valley and 50 to 60 mph
over the higher mountain peaks Sunday and Monday.

* Impacts: Wet roads and possible chain controls for the trans-
Sierra passes Sunday.

* Synopsis: A cold Pacific storm will bring rapid changes to NorCal
Sunday and Monday. Although rain and snow amounts will be
light, the storm will bring much colder temperatures and gusty
northerly winds Sunday and Monday.
